subject: Web3
title: Health Data Marketplaces
description: A short lesson to help you apply Health Data Marketplaces.

hook.text: Your health data is worth billions to researchers. Right now, hospitals profit from it â€” you don't.

buildup.text: Blockchain platforms could let patients sell anonymized health data directly to researchers and earn compensation.

discovery.text: Smart contracts would control access: researchers pay, the patient receives tokens, and data transfers automatically.

twist.text: Anonymization isn't foolproof. Combining datasets can re-identify individuals. Perfect health data privacy is extremely hard.

climax.text: If patients could monetize their own data, medical research might accelerate while individuals get fairly compensated.

punchline.text: Your health data has value. Blockchain could let you be the one who profits.

quiz.question: What is a risk of blockchain health data marketplaces?
options: Anonymized data can sometimes be re-identified by combining datasets
